name: add_contact

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the contact to be added.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the contact to be added.

description: Add a new contact with a specified name and address.

name: show_all_contact
description: Retrieve all contacts, sorted by the specified order.

name: show_contact_by_name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the contact to retrieve.

description: Retrieve a contact's details by their name.

name: transfer

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The destination address or contact name to which the crypto will be transferred.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount of crypto to be transferred.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The type of token to be transferred. Options include USDC and USDT.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The blockchain network on which the transfer will occur. Options include Base, Ethereum, and BSC.

parameters.name: run_mode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of operation for the system. The mode can be set to 'auto' for automatic operation or 'manual' for manual operation, depending on user preference or system configuration.

description: Transfers cryptocurrency to another wallet, specifying the destination address, amount, blockchain network, and token type.

name: switch_run_mode

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specifies the run mode. 'auto' will enable automatic operation, while 'manual' allows for manual control.

description: Switches the system's run mode between 'auto' for automatic operation and 'manual' for manual control. Use this function to toggle the current mode based on operational requirements.

name: switch_chain

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: Specifies the blockchain network. 'Base' refers to the Base chain, 'ETH' to the Ethereum network, and 'BSC' to the Binance Smart Chain.

description: Sets the system's blockchain network to one of the specified chains: 'Base', 'ETH' (Ethereum), or 'BSC' (Binance Smart Chain). Use this function to switch the operational blockchain network based on your requirements.
